project.teaser: Cultuurcampus pilots a new approach to city making through education, research, policy and culture at the heart of Rotterdam South, an area which is exemplary of the complex challenges and diverse potential of Europe’s most disadvantaged urban areas. In our approach, we...
project.objective:
Cultuurcampus pilots a new approach to city making through education, research, policy and culture at the heart of Rotterdam South, an area which is exemplary of the complex challenges and diverse potential of Europe’s most disadvantaged urban areas. In our approach, we facilitate the coming together of different types of knowledge - theoretical, practical, from the arts and sciences - with the lived experiences of citizens. We do so in three ways.
First, by co-creating a vibrant site of encounter, dialogue and shared learning. The Cultuurcampus will be housed in a historical building, the refurbishment of which unites a sustainable re-design vision of students of architecture and built environment, with the wishes and needs of local stakeholders, in a part of town where education and cultural institutions are scarce. This will be a hub for students, residents, social enterprise start-ups, lecturers and researchers – a place for learning, studying, community, art and culture.
Second, we will facilitate empowering the co-design of impact-oriented learning curricula, that can make the area more sustainable, inclusive, and enriching. From sustainable crafts and repair workshops open to all, to lifelong learning formats and Master level courses, we will test innovative didactic approaches geared towards activating and inspiring citizens, students, and lecturers in shaping a better future for Rotterdam South.
Third, we will ground our approach in participatory research and citizen science, that empowers residents to take part in the processes that shape their city and delivers a sound understanding of the area, its challenges and opportunities.
Evaluating our experience, we will identify the most effective strategies for delivering territorial transformations that build on situated knowledge of an area and where the vision is shaped and implemented through multi-stakeholder and multi-level collaborations.
project.title: Cultuurcampus: a sustainable hub of arts, research, learning and community as catalyst
project.keywords: Education, arts, culture, research, interdisciplinary, urban development, architecture, inclusion, co-design, city making, placemaking

article.title: Shaping a better future for Rotterdam South

result.title: "Update to the Cultuurcampus Lexicon #3"
result.description: Update to the Cultuurcampus Lexicon, describing the ways to communicate with and about the neighbourhood, based on the learnings of the last 6 months.

result.title: Six re-designed course programmes for on-site delivery
result.description: Six course programmes, re-designed for on-site delivery. The course programmes will each outline the curriculum and the learning objectives for each re-designed course.

result.title: Action plan for how to conduct participatory and action-based research on area needs, and desired and experienced impact of the pilot
result.description: A report outlining the target groups, timelines and methodologies for conducting the action-based research on area needs.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CULTUURCAMPUS (Cultuurcampus: a sustainable hub of arts, research, learning and community as catalyst)
result.teaser: Cultuur&Campus Putselaan (C&CP) pilots a new approach to city making through education, research, policy and culture, in the heart of Rotterdam South. In its contribution to tackling societal and environmental challenges, it supports the coming together of different types of...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: "Update to the Cultuurcampus Lexicon #1"
result.description: Update to the Cultuurcampus Lexicon, describing the ways to communicate with and about the neighbourhood, based on the learnings of the last 6 months.

result.title: Cultuurcampus Lexicon
result.description: We will create a Cultuurcampus Lexicon, describing the ways to communicate with and about the neighbourhood. It will include key messages, key language and appropriate ways to use them for each target group.

result.title: "Periodic Lessons Learned Report #3"
result.description: Update to the first report. A report narrating the journey of Cultuurcampus up until this stage, including the challenges and lessons learned. This will differ from the progress reports in that they will be targeted towards a broader, public audience. The purpose of these is to build a community around the Cultuurcampus and to inspire other partnerships across Europe to initiate their own Cultuurcampus.

result.title: Website and social media channels
result.description: This deliverable concerns the establishing of a website and social media channels for the project

result.title: Analysis of the current state and potential of the building in heritage, integration, inclusiveness, energy, and materials
result.description: An analysis of the current state and potential of the building in terms of heritage integration inclusiveness energy and materials

result.title: "Periodic lessons learned report #1"
result.description: A report narrating the journey of Cultuurcampus up until this stage, including the challenges and lessons learned. This will differ from the progress reports in that they will be targeted towards a broader, public audience. The purpose of these is to build a community around the Cultuurcampus and to inspire other partnerships across Europe to initiate their own Cultuurcampus.

result.title: Online neighbourhood dashboard
result.description: An online neighbourhood dashboard This dashboard has an accessible and interactive interface, according to the FAIR principles, and include a mapping of local stakeholders.

result.title: "Periodic lessons learned report #2"
result.description: Update to the first report. A report narrating the journey of Cultuurcampus up until this stage, including the challenges and lessons learned. This will differ from the progress reports in that they will be targeted towards a broader, public audience. The purpose of these is to build a community around the Cultuurcampus and to inspire other partnerships across Europe to initiate their own Cultuurcampus.

result.title: Needs assessment plan and implementation
result.description: We will create a needs assessment plan and implementation The plan will provide a framework for monitoring and evaluation of area stakeholders their needs and indicate priority areas of attention and opportunity Building on an inventory of existing secondary contextual data sources and data eg available demographic health environment education cultural participation statistics on the area reports but also mapping the landscape of stakeholders and taking stock of the Rotterdam Area Profile we will identify areas requiring further monitoring eg identifying intersectional needs resource deficiencies or opportunities to be followed up via codesigned participatory research The deliverable will be an online report outlining the needs and opportunities in the neighbourhood

result.title: Campus Studio programme
result.description: We will create a campus Studio programme, which will be a programme of activities centering of questions of societal relevance to residents of Rotterdam South. The focus will be on bringing large societal challenges (climate crisis, resilience, health etc.) to a more human scale, making space for exchange of ideas, debate.The deliverable will be a booklet or report that outlines the first Campus Studio programme of activities. Revised every six months.

result.title: "Update to the Cultuurcampus Lexicon #2"
result.description: Update to the Cultuurcampus Lexicon, describing the ways to communicate with and about the neighbourhood, based on the learnings of the last 6 months.

result.title: Programme of artistic and cultural activities
result.description: The programme consists of an agenda of artistic and cultural placemaking events, at the heart of which will be community engagement. The programme will include music performances, theatre, poetry slams, open mic sessions and other events. The events will take place at the school and at the venues of other social and cultural associations in the area (including public spaces and the future Cultuur&Campus location). The deliverable will be a booklet containing the first programme of activities, to be commenced at the start of the second year of the project. The programme will be updated every three months.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
